LET US REMAIN Premier League want Brexit exemption from Government with stars at risk of failing work permit tests 
Cesar Azpilicueta and Juan Mata head list of players who would be barred from playing in England once Brexit is confirmed By Duncan Wright 31st March 2017, 8:48 am Updated: 31st March 2017, 9:42 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments THE Premier League is pushing for the Government to give them special exemption from their Brexit immigration plans. 
Whitehall officials have begun the process of drawing up the new UK border control policies once the country has quit the European Union. Rex Features 4 European players such as Juan Mata could fail work permit tests once Brexit is confirmed 
And clubs fear they could be hit hard unless footballers are given a status of being exempt from usual work permit rules. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest football news , gossip and rumours 
Under current guidelines, footballers from non-EU countries have to have represented their countries in a set amount of competitive international games in a sliding scale ranging from 30-75 per cent of fixtures, depending on the country’s ranking. Getty Images 4 Cesar Azpilicueta is another star who would be blocked from playing in the Premier League 
If those rules are adopted for European players from 2019, it would mean the likes of Cesar Azpilicueta and Juan Mata would both be denied a work permit to play. 
Mata’s Manchester United teammate Ander Herrera is another who would be barred – and Premier League clubs are seeking urgent talks with Government officials to resolve the issue. 
In the past, chancellor Phillip Hammond has said “highly-skilled and highly-paid workers” should be exempt from the new controls, and it is this area clubs are seeking to capitalise on.
